title: Judge Stops Case Against Comedian Reginald D Hunter
summary: A judge has stopped a case against comedian Reginald D Hunter. The case was brought by a group called the Campaign Against Antisemitism (CAA), who said Hunter sent mean messages online. The judge, Michael Snow, said the CAA was not being honest and wanted to use the court to get Hunter 'cancelled', which means to make people stop liking or hiring him. Hunter is a funny person on TV shows. He thanked his lawyers and hoped he could work again. The judge found that the CAA did not tell the whole story about the messages and hid information. This shows that the court system should be used fairly, not for bad reasons.

background_read: This article is about a legal case in the UK where a group tried to sue a comedian for sending messages online. The judge stopped the case because he thought the group was not being truthful and wanted to harm the comedian's career. It teaches us about fairness in courts and how people should not misuse the legal system for personal reasons.

WHAT: A case was stopped because it was not fair
WHERE: Westminster Magistrates' Court in the UK
WHY: To show that courts should be used properly, not to cancel people
